++ Type Conversion Operator


+++ SUMMARY

Special type of MemberFunction in C++
  * allows class to define how a class converts to another class.
  * [operator] keyword is used to define them.


+++ EXAMPLE 1

class MyClass {
public:
    operator int() const {
        return someValue;
    }
};


operator int() is a type conversion operator
  * allows objects of MyClass to be implicitly converted to int. 
  * When an object of MyClass is used in a context where an int is expected, 
    * this operator function will be invoked to perform the conversion.


+++ PARENT
